docs.lead_paragraph: Leslie H. Gelb reviews Leon Panetta’s memoir, which recounts a career in public service, including stints as White House chief of staff, director of the C.I.A. and defense secretary.
docs.snippet: Leslie H. Gelb reviews Leon Panetta’s memoir, which recounts a career in public service, including stints as White House chief of staff, director of the C.I.A. and defense secretary....
docs.abstract: Leslie H Gelb reviews book Worthy Fights: A Memoir of Leadership in War and Peace by Leon Panetta with Jim Newton.

docs.lead_paragraph: Joe Bart Watts was mining coal 3 miles in a mountain when his house burned down last summer. Over the next year, Harlan Cumberland Coal cut his hours, laid off 200 workers and he had to move in with his mother.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. de la Renta dressed the wives of American presidents and socialites, but it was Hollywood glitz that defined him for a new age and a new customer.

byline.original: By CATHY HORYN and ENID NEMY

docs.snippet: Mr. de la Renta dressed the wives of American presidents and socialites, but it was Hollywood glitz that defined him for a new age and a new customer....
docs.abstract: Oscar de la Renta, doyen of American fashion whose career began in 1950s, dies at age 82; de la Renta achieved fame in two distinct realms as couturier to socialites and as a red-carpet king.

headline.print_headline: Designer Who Clothed Stars, and Became One
headline.main: Oscar de la Renta, Who Clothed Stars and Became One, Dies at 82

docs.lead_paragraph: A diplomatic incident involving unnamed public officials has transfixed Hungarian political circles and provided fresh evidence of tension between the two nations.
docs.snippet: A diplomatic incident involving unnamed public officials has transfixed Hungarian political circles and provided fresh evidence of tension between the two nations....
docs.abstract: Move by United States government to declare six Hungarian public officials ineligible for visas has blown up into diplomatic incident that has transfixed Hungarian political circles and provided fresh evidence of growing tension between two nations.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Denial of Visas for 6 in Hungary Strains Ties
headline.main: U.S. Denial of Visas for 6 in Hungary Strains Ties

docs.lead_paragraph: A way of life is eroding as small towns hemorrhage younger residents, a potent but unpredictable undercurrent in a closely fought Senate race.
docs.snippet: A way of life is eroding as small towns hemorrhage younger residents, a potent but unpredictable undercurrent in a closely fought Senate race....
docs.abstract: Iowa is undergoing economic transformation that is challenging its rural character and its political order; scale at which people and power have shifted from its rural towns to its urban areas is emerging as potent undercurrent in very close race between Joni Ernst and Bruce Braley as Iowans prepare to elect new United States senator (Series: States in Play).

headline.main: With Farms Fading and Urban Might Rising, Power Shifts in Iowa
headline.print_headline: As Farm Life Fades, Power Shifts in Heartland

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton urged Democratic voters not to be complacent about the November midterm elections, saying Monday that working women and their families will lose out on a better future if Republicans gain control of both houses of Congress.

docs.lead_paragraph: Former President Bill Clinton described U.S. Sen. Mary Landrieu as one of the Senate's most bipartisan and effective lawmakers, offering a high-profile campaign boost Monday to the Democratic incumbent ahead of the start of Louisiana's early voting period.

docs.lead_paragraph: Although he does nothing to court publicity, many call Rear Adm. Timothy Ziemer one of the most effective leaders in public health.
docs.snippet: Although he does nothing to court publicity, many call Rear Adm. Timothy Ziemer one of the most effective leaders in public health....
docs.abstract: Profile of R Timothy Ziemer, retired Navy pilot turned coordinator of President's Malaria Initiative; malaria deaths worldwide have fallen by 40 percent since Ziemer took job in 2006, earning him reputation as one of most effective leaders in public health.
